      • getDocumentsTouchedAtOrAfterTimestamp

        protected java.util.Set<ChronoIndexDocument> getDocumentsTouchedAtOrAfterTimestamp(long timestamp,
                                                                                   java.util.Set<java.lang.String> branches)
        Description copied from class: AbstractDocumentBasedIndexManagerBackend
        Returns the set of documents that were added and/or modified exactly at the given timestamp, or after the given timestamp.
        Specified by:
        getDocumentsTouchedAtOrAfterTimestamp in class AbstractDocumentBasedIndexManagerBackend
        Parameters:
        timestamp - The timestamp in question. Must not be negative.
        branches - The set of branches to retrieve the documents for. If null, documents from all branches will be retrieved. If this set is empty, then the result set will also be empty.
        Returns:
        The set of index documents that were added and/or modified exactly at or after the given timestamp. May be empty, but never null.

      • getMatchingBranchLocalDocuments

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,com.google.common.collect.SetMultimap<java.lang.Object,ChronoIndexDocument>> getMatchingBranchLocalDocuments(ChronoIdentifier chronoIdentifier)
        Description copied from interface: DocumentBasedIndexManagerBackend
        Queries the indexer state to return all documents that match the given ChronoIdentifier.

        This search does not include origin branches. It only searches directly on the branch indicated by the given identifier.

        Parameters:
        chronoIdentifier - The identifier to get the index documents for. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        A mapping from indexer name to a map from indexed value to the index document that holds this value. May be empty, but never null.
